bug.author: hzy46
bug.summary: Line number in stdout box is more than 200

comments.comment:
Seems due to carriage-return. Refer to: <denchmark-link:https://unix.stackexchange.com/questions/374592/carriage-return-with-echo-command/374593>https://unix.stackexchange.com/questions/374592/carriage-return-with-echo-command/374593</denchmark-link> . In Linux, when using , the cursor will back to begin. The logs is like: <denchmark-code>^M>> Downloading cifar-10-python.tar.gz 0.0%^M>>...... </denchmark-code>
In back-end, it just one line. But in browser, according to <denchmark-link:https://stackoverflow.com/questions/42853690/cross-browser-compatible-carriage-return-in-textarea>https://stackoverflow.com/questions/42853690/cross-browser-compatible-carriage-return-in-textarea</denchmark-link> . It will treat carriage-return as a new line.

Not easy to fix. According to <denchmark-link:https://superuser.com/questions/1062584/why-is-carriage-return-badly-handled-in-redirections>https://superuser.com/questions/1062584/why-is-carriage-return-badly-handled-in-redirections</denchmark-link> . The terminal output is processed by terminal. But when redirect to file, it not be processed. Will truncate first
